result.execSummary:
All charges against Killion Paul Pelnar in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Killion Paul Pelnar is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

Per bond. arc
**AMENDED** Signed by EFV 02/01/22. ec: attys, email: DHS, Vicki.  arc
Email to DHS and Vicki S. Update Defendants current address. arc

** AMENDED**

Defendant to be directly transported from St.Croix County Jail to Transitions 847 Highview Drive Unit B, New Richmond, WI by Bonnie Edlund with adult protection. Defendant to reside at Transitions until further order of the Court. If Defendant is discharged or leaves Transitions, Law Enforcement to be notified immediately, and Defendant to immediately report to the St.Croix County Jail. If a more appropriate placement is approved by the guardian, the Court to be notified within 1 business day by Bonnie Edlund with adult protection , and the bond to apply to new placement. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Officer Elias Schendel unless in his official capacity.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

03:04 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Kaitlyn Dippolito with Atty Abriana Dolfi, DF: Killion Paul Pelnar appears from jail. Set for PH. Court reviews case. Atty Dippolito requests to proceed through ARGN. Court agrees. Atty Dippolito notes DE is close to housing arrangements. Atty Dippolito waives Prelim hearing. Court refers to waiver. Off record 03:09 PM for Atty Dippolito to fill out/sign Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form with DE. Back on record 03:13PM. Court questions DE. Sidebar. Court will not enter Waiver of Preliminary Hearing on todays date due to compentency issues. Court reviews complaint and makes findings. Court orders Competency Examination. Court states if placement is found for DE, Court will place back on calendar as soon as possible. Court sets Competency Hearing. Adjourned 03:22PM.  Competency hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:26 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo  DF ATTY: Travis Satorius and Kaitlin Dippolito for today   DF:  Killion Paul Pelnar appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; sidebar. Off record at 1:33 PM. Recalled at 2:04 PM. Appearances as previouly stated. Sidebar. Court orders cash bond, but will reconsider with information regarding group home. Court sets BBH and reserves on other issues and scheduling Preliminary Hearing until that time. Adjourned at 2:08 PM.  gll  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
